# Alsip {.unnumbered}

## CCDPH Epidemiology
Cook County Department of Public Health's Epidemiology program is one of four *public health programs* operated by the department . The Unit is composed of a Director (non-union), Program Coordinator (non-union), five full-time epidemiologists (mostly union staff), and, on occasion, fellows funded through the Council of State and Territorial Epidemiologists (CSTE) Applied Epidemiology Fellowship (AEF) program. The current Epidemiology Unit organizational chart is shown in @fig-epiorgchart, along with names and relevant degrees of position holders.

![Epidemiology Unit Organizational Chart](images/org_chart_ccdph_epi_unit.PNG){#fig-epiorgchart fig-alt="CCDPH Epidemiology Unit Organizational Chart."}

The [Epidemiology Unit's web page](https://cookcountypublichealth.org/epidemiology-data-reports/) provides information about unit activities and products including [community health status assessments](https://cookcountypublichealth.org/epidemiology-data-reports/community-health-status-assessments/), data briefs, and [vital statistics](https://cookcountypublichealth.org/epidemiology-data-reports/vital-statistics/). 

## Cook County Department of Public Health (CCDPH)
The [Cook County Department of Public Health](https://cookcountypublichealth.org) (CCDPH) is the nationally accredited, state-certified local health department for suburban Cook County. CCDPH serves approximately 2.3 million residents with a jurisdiction covering 120 municipalities, 30 townships, and 147 school districts. The organization of the 

CCDPH is one of six local health departments (LHDs) within Cook County. The other five are the [Chicago Department of Public Health](https://www.chicago.gov/city/en/depts/cdph.html), the [City of Evanston Department of Health and Human Services](https://www.cityofevanston.org/government/departments/health-human-services), the [Village of Oak Park Department of Public Health](https://www.oak-park.us/village-services/department-public-health), the [Stickney Township Public Health District](http://stickneypublichealthdistrict.org/) and the [Village of Skokie Health Department](https://www.skokie.org/158/Health). The [latest contact information for local health departments in Illinois](https://idph.illinois.gov/IDPHPrograms/v_LHDDirectory/Show-V-LHDDirectory-Public.aspx?RegionServed=7) can be found on the Illinois Department of Public Health website.

The Department is certified by the [Illinois Department of Public Health](https://dph.illinois.gov/) (IDPH) and is nationally accredited by the Public Health Accreditation Boar (PHAB). The department is an affiliate of [Cook County Health](https://cookcountyhealth.org), one of the largest public safety net health care systems in the country. A brief [CCDPH two-page fact sheet](https://cookcountypublichealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/02/ccdph_fact_sheet_090616_final.pdf) is available via the CCDPH web page. The web page also includes information on upcoming events, 

The [CCDPH Intranet pages](https://cchhs1.sharepoint.com/sites/Department-of-Public-Health) provides information about the department's [divisions, units, programs, initiatives and work areas](https://cchhs1.sharepoint.com/sites/Department-of-Public-Health/SitePages/Our-teams.aspx).

## Cook County Health & Hospital System

[Cook County Health](https://cookcountyhealth.org/) (CCH) is one of the largest public health systems in the United States and has [a long history](https://cookcountyhealth.org/wp-content/uploads/CCHHS-Milestones-Combined-Display-6-14.pdf) of providing health services to Cook County residents. The Cook County Hospital Administration Building (1835 West Harrison Street) [received landmark status](https://www.chicago.gov/content/dam/city/depts/zlup/Historic_Preservation/Publications/Cook_County_Hospital_Administration_Bldg.pdf) by the Commission on Chicago Landmarks in 2018.

The system operates: *Cook County Department of Public Health*, a state and nationally certified public health department serving suburban Cook County; *John H. Stroger, Jr. Hospital of Cook County*, a 450-bed tertiary, acute care hospital in the Illinois Medical District; *Provident Hospital of Cook County*, 79-bed community acute care hospital on the South Side of Chicago; *More than a dozen community health centers throughout Cook County* offering primary and specialty care, along with diagnostic services; *The Ruth M. Rothstein CORE Center*, a comprehensive care center for patients with HIV and other infectious diseases. The CORE Center is the largest provider of HIV care in the Midwest and one of the largest in the nation; *Correctional Health Services* providing health care services to the detainees at the Cook County Jail and residents of the Juvenile Temporary Detention Center; and *CountyCare*, the largest Medicaid managed care plan in Cook County.

CCH is governed by a [board of directors](https://cookcountyhealth.org/about/board-of-directors/). According to its latest strategic plan, CCH aims, "To deliver integrated health services with dignity and respect regardless of a patientâ€™s ability to pay; foster partnerships with other health providers and communities to enhance the health of the public; and advocate for policies which promote and protect the physical, mental and social well-being of the people of Cook County." 

The [CCH Intranet pages](http://cchintranet.cchhs.local/intranet/) includes a wide range of information concerning its departments, locations, policy portal, and more.
